title: TMU Athletics & Recreation Raises Over $145,000 on Bold Giving Day
text: On December 3, Toronto Metropolitan University (TMU) Athletics and Recreation successfully launched its inaugural Bold Giving Day, raising over $145,000 in a 24-hour online event. This achievement followed the active participation of the TMU community, including student-athletes and coaches, galvanizing support for sports teams. The event recorded more than 580 donations directed towards 24 teams, each benefiting from matching funds to amplify impact. Executive Director Louise Cowin emphasized the significance of community support, while funds will enhance training resources and other needs for student-athletes. - $145,000 raised in total from Bold Giving Day. - 580 donations made by supporters. While the event's fundraising success is noteworthy, it also highlights the ongoing need for financial support in collegiate athletics, suggesting that continued engagement and donations will be essential for sustaining programs and enhancing the student-athlete experience. State of Play- 24 teams participated in the fundraising event. - Funds are allocated towards training, equipment, and travel for student-athletes. Supporters who missed the initial giving day can still donate at BoldGivingDay.ca for one more week. This extended opportunity may further increase the amount raised and strengthen TMU's commitment to student-athletes. Bottom LineThe success of Bold Giving Day not only marks a historic milestone for TMU Athletics but also establishes a foundation for future philanthropic efforts, emphasizing the essential role of community support in enhancing the student-athlete experience.
